Aikido-TheArtOfPeace.name: Aikido - The Art of Peace
Aikido-TheArtOfPeace.summary: Aikido is a Japanese martial art focused on peace and harmony, using an opponent's energy through grappling rather than striking. It teaches non-violent conflict resolution by blending with aggression and fostering mental and physical calm. This philosophy applies broadly, helping individuals of all ages and physical abilities find peaceful solutions in various life situations.

MeetMutsukoMinegishiThe84-Year-OldJapane.name: Meet Mutsuko Minegishi, The 84-Year-Old Japanese Martial Art Master
MeetMutsukoMinegishiThe84-Year-OldJapane.summary: Mutsuko Minegishi, an 84-year-old Japanese martial arts master, began Aikido in 1972 when it was male-dominated. She emphasizes that Aikido is for everyone and has built her confidence in all aspects of life. Minegishi highlights that the practice teaches important life principles and promotes healthy living.
